At our high school there was some guy who would shit and then make pictures on the stalls, with said shit. We called him poocasso. He was never caught and he did this every couple of months for all four years. Someone one come running into class yelling "poocasso has struck again! Poocasso is back!" I had the theory that it was one of the janitors, knowing he would never be caught.

They are great, especially after I finished the show and got to watch it again with a stronger connection to the characters. I love the whole show though, even after Donald left:/ I did love the addition of professor Dickie however and wish he would have been in the show instead of pierce.

I honestly think watching the whole show a second time through made me love the show so much more because for a large part of the 1st and second seasons you don't really know the characters very well yet and a lot of the jokes are less funny because you don't have a connection with the characters. But on the other hand, the comedy in the show is very quirky and weird. It doesn't translate well to a lot of people, but resonates very strongly and is very relatable to weird quirky people, like me. All in all, the writing is fantastic, the comedic timing is spot on, and the characters are very lovable and relatable, in my opinion at least.
It was so good I'm watching it all the way through for the 6th or 7th time right now, it just keeps getting funnier and funnier.

People don't down vote comments that aren't funny, they just skip over them. People down vote things that offend them. That's why I defended my political views. Not just to you but to EVERYONE. Because this is the Internet and other people than you will see my comment. Now about the whole thinking you were op, you are right... I did. I was wrong. Whoops. Doesn't really matter as far as the rest of my point went. Now you just seem like you're embarrassed about the racist thing you posted and the fact that you support trump (anybody who doesn't support trump would have thought that was as funny as I did) and you should be ashamed. We don't live before the civil war. Everyone was created equally and if you don't believe it, think about if you were born black or Muslim. Is that your fault? Would your emotions and feelings matter less just because your skin is a different color?
